intro: Anotites jonesii, commonly known as Jones' anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features showy, white to pale pink flowers with a distinctive yellow center, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a hairy texture, while its stems are often reddish in color. Anotites jonesii thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
